Package com.peyrona.mingle.cil.rules

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peyrona.mingle.cil.Command
      • com.peyrona.mingle.cil.rules.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.ICommand, com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.IRule
    public final class Rule
extends Command
implements com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.IRule
    RULE commands provide the logic to the language.

    Rules can be dynamically added and removed: this is something that has to be done carefully: adding dynamically a rule does not passes all the "controls" that are passed by the transpiler; e.g.: time units can not be used: time has to be expressed in milliseconds.

    On the other hand, adding devices that belongs to an existing group will not affect to Rules (these changes will be ignored by rules) that were defined as using this group. And removing a device that is used by a Rule will eventually end with an exception. In other words: groups are not dynamically (on-the-fly) updated.
    Developers that add Rules at runtime do it at their own risk (all checks are done at transpiler time): a big power comes with a big responsibility.

    Author:
    Francisco Jos√© Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start​(com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.exen.IRuntime rt)
        Description copied from class: Command
        This method is invoked for every command and only once (successive invocations for same command will be ignored). The ExEn invokes this method just after the command is added to the ExEn (only after the thread started).

        Implementation note: at this class this method assigns passed bus to an interval variable.

        Specified by:
        start in interface com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.ICommand
        Overrides:
        start in class Command

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from class: Command
        This method is invoked for every command and only once (subsequent invocations for same command will be ignored). The ExEn invokes this method just before the command is about to be removed from the ExEn or the ExEn is about to finish its execution.

        At this class this method makes the bus null (to be collected by the GC).

        Specified by:
        stop in interface com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands.ICommand
        Overrides:
        stop in class Command
